page.title: 04 BRENLEY FARM FAVERSHAM
page.content: Brenley farm is a typical hop growing farm in the area.With an acreage of 350,it is leased to Mr M.Berry by Prudential.Brenley is a mixed farm employing 8 full time workers,and taking on casuals when needed. 62 acres of the farm are devoted to hop growing.The varieties of hops grown are Golding Challenger and North Down. The hop gardens are planted and strung in January.The plants are handed in and trained until April.About June the bines have reached full height.They are checked for wilt and cut down in September.They are picked by machine, then taken to the oast for drying before transportation to the Shepherd Neame brewery in Faversham. Brenley,being a mixed farm also grows a range of fruits,such as cherries, pears and apples.When these are picked they are sent to E.K.P.
